title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
text: file provides guidance Claude Code (claude.ai/code) working code repository.

title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
text: mediationverse meta-package provides unified entry point mediation analysis ecosystem R. Similar tidyverse data science easystats statistical modeling, mediationverse loads core packages single library(mediationverse) call.

title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
text: Simplify installation loading complete mediation analysis toolkit, ensuring users access complementary packages model fitting, effect sizes, confidence intervals, sensitivity analysis.

title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
code: # Install package dependencies remotes::install_deps(dependencies = TRUE)  # Check package (standard R CMD check) rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args = "--no-manual", error_on = "error")  # Build package devtools::build()  # Install and reload during development devtools::load_all()

title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
text: mediationverse_attach(): Internal function load core packages is_attached(): Check packages attached package_version_string(): Get package versions .onAttach(): Startup message package versions

title: CLAUDE.md for mediationverse Package
text: mediationverse_packages(): List installed ecosystem packages versions mediationverse_update(): Update packages latest versions mediationverse_conflicts(): Show function name conflicts packages mediationverse_logo(): ASCII art logo

text: mediationverse package ready pushed GitHub.

title: GitHub Setup Instructions
text: Go GitHub: https://github.com/organizations/data-wise/repositories/new Repository Settings: Repository name: mediationverse Description: Meta-package mediation analysis ecosystem R Visibility: Public initialize README, .gitignore, license (already ) Push GitHub: Set GitHub Pages (pkgdown): Add README.md data-wise organization: Add mediationverse list repositories Link https://github.com/data-wise/mediationverse
code: cd ~/packages/mediationverse git remote add origin https://github.com/data-wise/mediationverse.git git branch -M main git push -u origin main usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages()

text: packages use badge order README.md:
code: <!-- badges: start --> [![Lifecycle: {status}](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-{status}-{color}.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#{status}) [![Repo Status](https://www.repostatus.org/badges/latest/{status}.svg)](https://www.repostatus.org/#{status}) [![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/{package})](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package={package}) [![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/data-wise/{package}/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/data-wise/{package}/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml) [![pkgdown](https://github.com/data-wise/{package}/actions/workflows/pkgdown.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/data-wise/{package}/actions/workflows/pkgdown.yaml) [![Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/data-wise/{package}/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/data-wise/{package}) <!-- badges: end -->

title: Mediationverse Ecosystem Status

title: Mediationverse Ecosystem Status
text: Maintainer: Davood Tofighi (dtofighi@gmail.com) ORCID: 0000-0001-8523-7776

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse collection R packages mediation analysis. provides unified ecosystem model fitting, effect size computation, confidence interval estimation, sensitivity analysis, simulation studies. vignette introduces core concepts shows get started mediationverse ecosystem.

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: Install mediationverse meta-package GitHub: install core packages: medfit - Infrastructure (S7 classes, model fitting, extraction, bootstrap) probmed - Probabilistic effect size (P_med) RMediation - Confidence intervals (Distribution Product, MBCO) medrobust - Sensitivity analysis (bounds, falsification) medsim - Simulation infrastructure
code: # Install with pak (recommended) pak::pak("data-wise/mediationverse")  # Or with remotes remotes::install_github("data-wise/mediationverse")

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: Load packages single command: attaches core packages displays summary:
code: library(mediationverse) -- Attaching packages ------------------- mediationverse 0.0.0.9000 -- v medfit     0.1.0     v probmed    0.1.0 v RMediation 1.4.0     v medrobust  0.1.0 v medsim     0.1.0 ---------------------------------------------------------------

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse provides utility functions manage ecosystem:
code: # List all mediationverse packages with versions and status mediationverse_packages() # Update all packages from GitHub/CRAN mediationverse_update() # Show function name conflicts between packages mediationverse_conflicts()

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # List all mediationverse packages with versions and status mediationverse_packages()

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Update all packages from GitHub/CRAN mediationverse_update()

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Show function name conflicts between packages mediationverse_conflicts()

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse follows consistent workflow mediation analysis: Using medfit, fit mediator outcome models: Extract path coefficients covariance matrix: MediationData object, can use ecosystem packages:
code: # Fit models fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata) med_data <- extract_mediation(   fit_m,   model_y = fit_y,   treatment = "X",   mediator = "M" )  # View the extracted structure print(med_data) # Distribution of Product method ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # Monte Carlo method ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000) # Compute P_med pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) # Bounds for unmeasured confounding bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(med_data) # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: Using medfit, fit mediator outcome models:
code: # Fit models fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: Extract path coefficients covariance matrix:
code: med_data <- extract_mediation(   fit_m,   model_y = fit_y,   treatment = "X",   mediator = "M" )  # View the extracted structure print(med_data)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: MediationData object, can use ecosystem packages:
code: # Distribution of Product method ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # Monte Carlo method ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000) # Compute P_med pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) # Bounds for unmeasured confounding bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(med_data) # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Distribution of Product method ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # Monte Carlo method ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Compute P_med pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Bounds for unmeasured confounding bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(med_data)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
code: # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse follows several design principles: medfit serves foundation, providing: S7 classes (MediationData, SerialMediationData, BootstrapResult) Model extraction methods Bootstrap infrastructure Common utilities package focuses one methodological contribution: packages use S7 classes type safety validation:
code: # MediationData validates input med_data <- MediationData(   a_path = 0.5,   b_path = 0.4,   c_prime = 0.1,   estimates = c(a = 0.5, b = 0.4, c_prime = 0.1),   vcov = matrix(c(0.01, 0, 0, 0, 0.01, 0, 0, 0, 0.01), 3, 3) )

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: vignette demonstrates complete mediation analysis workflow using packages mediationverse ecosystem. : Simulate data known ground truth Fit mediation models Extract mediation structure Compute confidence intervals Calculate effect sizes Perform sensitivity analysis Bootstrap inference

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code: library(mediationverse)  # Set seed for reproducibility set.seed(2025)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Using medsim, generate data known population parameters:
code: # Population parameters a_true <- 0.5    # X -> M effect b_true <- 0.4    # M -> Y effect c_prime_true <- 0.2  # X -> Y direct effect  # True indirect effect indirect_true <- a_true * b_true cat("True indirect effect:", indirect_true, "\n")  # Simulate data using medsim sim_data <- simulate_mediation(   n = 200,   a = a_true,   b = b_true,   c_prime = c_prime_true,   sigma_m = 1,   sigma_y = 1 )  head(sim_data)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Fit mediator outcome models using standard regression:
code: # Mediator model: M ~ X fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = sim_data)  # Outcome model: Y ~ X + M fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = sim_data)  # View summaries summary(fit_m) summary(fit_y)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Using medfit, extract mediation paths standardized object:
code:
med_data <- extract_mediation(   fit_m,   model_y = fit_y,   treatment = "X",   mediator = "M" )  # View the extracted structure print(med_data)  # Access individual paths cat("Estimated a path:", med_data@a_path, "
") cat("Estimated b path:", med_data@b_path, "
") cat("Estimated c' path:", med_data@c_prime, "
") cat("Estimated indirect effect:", med_data@a_path * med_data@b_path, "
")

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Use RMediation compute confidence intervals indirect effect: accurate method normal theory CIs: Simulation-based CIs work distribution:
code: ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop", level = 0.95) print(ci_dop) ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000, level = 0.95) print(ci_mc) # Create comparison table ci_comparison <- data.frame(   Method = c("DOP", "Monte Carlo"),   Lower = c(ci_dop$CI[1], ci_mc$CI[1]),   Upper = c(ci_dop$CI[2], ci_mc$CI[2]),   Width = c(diff(ci_dop$CI), diff(ci_mc$CI)) )  print(ci_comparison)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: accurate method normal theory CIs:
code: ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop", level = 0.95) print(ci_dop)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Simulation-based CIs work distribution:
code: ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000, level = 0.95) print(ci_mc)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code: # Create comparison table ci_comparison <- data.frame(   Method = c("DOP", "Monte Carlo"),   Lower = c(ci_dop$CI[1], ci_mc$CI[1]),   Upper = c(ci_dop$CI[2], ci_mc$CI[2]),   Width = c(diff(ci_dop$CI), diff(ci_mc$CI)) )  print(ci_comparison)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Compute P_med, probability positive indirect effect:
code: pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) print(pmed_result)  # P_med interpretation: # - 0.5 = no evidence of effect (coin flip) # - > 0.8 = strong evidence of positive effect # - < 0.2 = strong evidence of negative effect

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Assess robustness unmeasured confounding:
code: # Compute sensitivity bounds sens_bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(   med_data,   rho_range = c(-0.5, 0.5)  # Range of confounding )  print(sens_bounds)  # Falsification test falsification <- falsify_mediation(med_data, threshold = 0.1) print(falsification)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Perform bootstrap inference indirect effect:
code: # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(   med_data,   n_boot = 2000,   method = "nonparametric",   ci_level = 0.95 )  print(boot_result)  # Access bootstrap distribution hist(boot_result@boot_estimates,      main = "Bootstrap Distribution of Indirect Effect",      xlab = "Indirect Effect (a * b)",      col = "steelblue",      border = "white") abline(v = indirect_true, col = "red", lwd = 2, lty = 2) abline(v = boot_result@estimate, col = "blue", lwd = 2) legend("topright",        legend = c("True value", "Estimate"),        col = c("red", "blue"),        lwd = 2,        lty = c(2, 1))

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code:
# Compile all results results <- list(   # Point estimates   estimates = list(     a = med_data@a_path,     b = med_data@b_path,     indirect = med_data@a_path * med_data@b_path,     direct = med_data@c_prime   ),    # Confidence intervals   ci_dop = ci_dop$CI,   ci_mc = ci_mc$CI,   ci_boot = c(boot_result@ci_lower, boot_result@ci_upper),    # Effect size   pmed = pmed_result$pmed,    # Sensitivity   sensitivity = sens_bounds )  # Pretty print cat("=== Mediation Analysis Results ===

") cat("Point Estimates:
") cat("  a path (X -> M):", round(results$estimates$a, 3), "
") cat("  b path (M -> Y):", round(results$estimates$b, 3), "
") cat("  c' path (X -> Y):", round(results$estimates$direct, 3), "
") cat("  Indirect effect:", round(results$estimates$indirect, 3), "

")  cat("95% Confidence Intervals for Indirect Effect:
") cat("  DOP:", round(results$ci_dop, 3), "
") cat("  Monte Carlo:", round(results$ci_mc, 3), "
") cat("  Bootstrap:", round(results$ci_boot, 3), "

")  cat("Effect Size:
") cat("  P_med:", round(results$pmed, 3), "

")

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Based analysis: Point Estimate: indirect effect estimate close true value 0.20. Confidence Intervals: three methods (DOP, Monte Carlo, Bootstrap) provide similar intervals, suggesting robust inference. Effect Size: P_med > 0.8 indicates strong evidence indirect effect positive. Sensitivity: effect remains significant across reasonable levels unmeasured confounding.

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: mediationverse also supports structural equation models:
code: library(lavaan)  # Specify mediation model model <- '   # Regressions   M ~ a*X   Y ~ b*M + c*X    # Indirect effect   indirect := a*b '  # Fit model fit_lavaan <- sem(model, data = sim_data)  # Extract mediation structure med_data_lavaan <- extract_mediation(fit_lavaan)  # Use same analysis pipeline ci_lavaan <- ci(med_data_lavaan, type = "dop") print(ci_lavaan)

what: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Unified ecosystem mediation analysis R

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: mediationverse collection R packages mediation analysis, providing unified ecosystem : Model fitting extraction Effect size computation Confidence interval estimation Sensitivity analysis Simulation studies

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: mediationverse includes five core packages:

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Install GitHub (development version):
code: # Install mediationverse (loads all packages) pak::pak("data-wise/mediationverse")  # Or install packages individually pak::pak("data-wise/medfit") pak::pak("data-wise/probmed") pak::pak("data-wise/medrobust") pak::pak("data-wise/medsim")  # RMediation from CRAN install.packages("RMediation")

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Load packages one command:
code: library(mediationverse) #> -- Attaching packages ------------------ mediationverse 0.0.0.9000 -- #> v medfit     0.1.0     v probmed    0.1.0 #> v RMediation 1.4.0     v medrobust  0.1.0 #> v medsim     0.1.0 #> ---------------------------------------------------------------

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
code: # List installed packages and versions mediationverse_packages()  # Update all packages mediationverse_update()  # Check for function conflicts mediationverse_conflicts()

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
code: library(mediationverse)  # Fit mediation models (medfit) fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata)  # Extract mediation structure med_data <- extract_mediation(fit_m, model_y = fit_y,                                treatment = "X", mediator = "M")  # Bootstrap inference (medfit) boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)  # Compute probabilistic effect size (probmed) pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data)  # Get confidence intervals (RMediation) ci_result <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # Sensitivity analysis (medrobust) robust_result <- sensitivity_analysis(med_data)

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: mediationverse follows principles: Foundation Package: medfit provides shared S7 infrastructure Specialized Packages: package focuses one methodological contribution Consistent API: Unified interfaces across packages Type Safety: S7 classes ensure data integrity Comprehensive Testing: >90% code coverage across packages

text: Part mediationverse ecosystem causal mediation analysis:

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R ‚Äî mediationverse-package
text: mediationverse includes following packages: medfit: Infrastructure model fitting, extraction, bootstrap inference probmed: Probabilistic effect size (P_med) RMediation: Confidence intervals (DOP, MBCO, MC methods) medrobust: Sensitivity analysis unmeasured confounding medsim: Simulation infrastructure mediation research

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R ‚Äî mediationverse-package

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
text: Identifies functions exported multiple mediationverse packages, lead masking issues.

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
code: mediationverse_conflicts(only_loaded = TRUE)

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
text: only_loaded Logical. check currently loaded packages? Default TRUE.

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
text: data frame columns: function_name: Name conflicting function packages: Character vector packages exporting function winner: package whose version used (last loaded)

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
text: multiple packages export function name, R uses version package loaded last. function helps identify conflicts can use explicit namespacing (e.g., medfit::extract_mediation()) needed.

title: Show mediationverse Conflicts ‚Äî mediationverse_conflicts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Show conflicts among loaded mediationverse packages mediationverse_conflicts() } # }

text: Lists core packages mediationverse ecosystem along installation status versions.

title: List mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_packages
code: mediationverse_packages(include_self = TRUE)

title: List mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_packages
text: include_self Logical. Include mediationverse list? Default TRUE.

title: List mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_packages
text: data frame columns: package: Package name installed: Logical, whether package installed version: Package version (NA installed attached: Logical, whether package currently attached

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
text: Updates mediationverse packages latest versions GitHub CRAN.

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
code: mediationverse_update(packages = NULL, ...)

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
text: packages Character vector package names update. Default core packages. ... Additional arguments passed installation function.

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
text: Invisibly returns character vector updated package names.

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
text: function uses pak::pak() available (recommended), otherwise falls back remotes::install_github() GitHub packages utils::install.packages() CRAN packages. Package sources: mediationverse: GitHub (data-wise/mediationverse) medfit: GitHub (data-wise/medfit) probmed: GitHub (data-wise/probmed) RMediation: CRAN medrobust: GitHub (data-wise/medrobust) medsim: GitHub (data-wise/medsim)

title: Update mediationverse Packages ‚Äî mediationverse_update
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Update all packages mediationverse_update()  # Update specific packages mediationverse_update(c("medfit", "probmed")) } # }

title: mediationverse (development version)
text: Initial package skeleton core functionality mediationverse_packages() - List installed ecosystem packages versions mediationverse_update() - Update ecosystem packages GitHub/CRAN mediationverse_conflicts() - Detect display function name conflicts Startup message displays attached packages loading mediationverse

title: mediationverse (development version)
text: mediationverse meta-package provides unified access : medfit - Infrastructure (S7 classes, model fitting, extraction, bootstrap) probmed - Probabilistic effect size (P_med) RMediation - Confidence intervals (Distribution Product, MBCO) medrobust - Sensitivity analysis (bounds, falsification) medsim - Simulation infrastructure
